boat.name: Phoenix
boat.full_description:
Bob Spackman bought the derelict hull off the beach at Prinstead, Chichester Harbour in 1990. He spent three years restoring her and launched 'Phoenix' in spring 1993. He made the mast and spars himself and bought a set of sails second hand from a Norfolk One Design which have proved admirable in terms of sail area, power and aesthetics. Her hull is fibreglass, heavy construction with a wooden gunwale. It is decked forward of the mast and has an oak bowsprit. There are buoyancy tanks inbuilt port and starboard in the stern half of the boat and a large buoyancy tank under the foredeck.

In 2012 she needed significant work, mainly a new keel and scarfing a new section on the mast that had rotted.

She is mainly sailed in Chichester Harbour but Bob has trailed her to the Baltic, West Coast of Scotland, Gulf of Morbihan, France, Roseland Peninsula and the OGA Trailer Section rally in Norfolk, 2014.
boat.short_description: Originally built around 1960, she was bought as a derelict hull in 1990, and rebuilt as a gunter sloop.
